conclusion: Determine the maximum horizontal force F that can be applied to block B without causing relative motion between blocks A and B.
Mass of block A is 1 kg and maximum static friction force between A and B is 1 N.
Static friction force between block A and block B must be less than or equal to 1 N to prevent relative motion.
Mass of block B is 2 kg and coefficient of kinetic friction between B and the ground is 0.1.
Normal force exerted by the ground on block B is calculated as N = 30 N.
Kinetic friction force between B and the ground is calculated as f_k = 3 N.
For A and B to remain relatively stationary, the net force on B must not exceed 1 N.
Formulate the equation for relative stationarity: F - 3 N â‰¤ 1 N.
F must not exceed 4 N to keep A and B relatively stationary.
The condition for keeping A and B relatively stationary is that the horizontal force F does not exceed 4 N.
